intro: Corydalis cataractarum, commonly known as the waterfall corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces a cluster of small, oval-shaped leaves and has a creeping rhizome that allows it to spread along the ground. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appeal make it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
